content: A global full text search refers to a search functionality that allows a user to search for specific words or phrases within an entire collection of documents, regardless of their location or format. This type of search is typically implemented using specialized software, such as a search engine, that is able to index and search the text in the documents quickly and efficiently. The search results can include a list of documents that contain the searched words or phrases, along with information such as the relevance or rank of each result.
